maml:description.maml:para: Query Azure Graph API for object details
Use the $top oData filter to query objects in bulk using paging.

maml:Description.maml:para: An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
Some of the API versions in Graph are 'beta' - default to 1.0
Used to determine how many records to return per page. Microsoft Graph behaviors are per api...
The object type to query. Paging with the $top filter is supported for all /users, but the $top filter is rejected.
An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
Some of the API versions in Graph are 'beta' - default to 1.0
Used to determine how many records to return per page. Microsoft Graph behaviors are per api...
The object type to query. Paging with the $top filter is supported for all /users, but the $top filter is rejected.

maml:description.maml:para: Query Azure Graph API for basic user details
Requires having identity set in Azure AD to allow access to Graph API, and an Azure AD Application registered to get an API OAuth token from.

maml:Description.maml:para: A valid user userPrincipalName
An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
Optional to query specified information about the user object.
A valid user userPrincipalName
An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
Optional to query specified information about the user object.

maml:description.maml:para: Query Azure Log Analytics
Requires having identity set in Azure AD to allow access to Log Analytics API, and an Azure AD Application registered to get an API OAuth token from.

maml:Description.maml:para: The workspaceID reference for this API is the subscription which has the Log Analytics account.
An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
A valid Log Analytics query. Example = 'AzureDiagnostics | where ResultType == "Failed" | where RunbookName_s == "Name of runbook" |where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)'
The workspaceID reference for this API is the subscription which has the Log Analytics account.
An OAuth accessToken. See Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser as a possible source.
A valid Log Analytics query. Example = 'AzureDiagnostics | where ResultType == "Failed" | where RunbookName_s == "Name of runbook" |where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)'

maml:description.maml:para: Get azure marketplace usage
For getting marketplace usage data.

maml:Description.maml:para: Your Enterprise Enrollment number. Available form the EA portal.
API key gathered from the EA portal for use with billing API.
An optional parameter to specify that you wish to get from the following year and month. Format YYYYMM
Start date time of the query - ####-##-## year, month, day = 2017-01-28
End date time of the query - ####-##-## year, month, day = 2017-01-28
Your Enterprise Enrollment number. Available form the EA portal.
API key gathered from the EA portal for use with billing API.

maml:description.maml:para: Get Valid OAuth Token. The access token is good for an hour, and there is no refresh token.

This OAuth token is intended for use with CLI, automation, and service calls. No user interaction is required. Requires an application to be registered in Azure AD with appropriate API permissions configured.

maml:Description.maml:para: Azure AD Directory ID/TenantID
Azure AD Custom Application ID
Azure AD Custom Application access key
Resource to be interacted with. Example = https://api.loganalytics.io. Use the clientID here if authenticating a token to your own custom app.
Azure AD Directory ID/TenantID
Azure AD Custom Application ID
Azure AD Custom Application access key
Resource to be interacted with. Example = https://api.loganalytics.io. Use the clientID here if authenticating a token to your own custom app.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $tokenInfo = Get-AzureOAuthTokenService -tenantID 'Azure AD Tenant ID' -clientid 'Application ID' -accessKey 'Preset key for app' -resource 'MS API Resource'

maml:description.maml:para: Get Valid OAuth Token. The access token is good for an hour, the refresh token is mostly permanent and can be used to get a new access token without having to re-authenticate
This is based on authenticating against a custom Web/API Application registered in Azure AD which has permissions to Azure AD, Azure Management, and other APIs.

maml:Description.maml:para: Azure AD Directory ID/TenantID
Azure AD Custom Application ID
Azure AD Custom Application access key
For return stream of claims
Resource to be interacted with. Example = https://api.loganalytics.io, or https://graph.microsoft.com
Define if your app login should prompt the user for consent in the Azure portal on login. none = will never request and rely on SSO (web apps)
Supply a refresh token to get a new valid token for use after expiring
Azure AD Directory ID/TenantID
Azure AD Custom Application ID
Azure AD Custom Application access key
For return stream of claims
Resource to be interacted with. Example = https://api.loganalytics.io, or https://graph.microsoft.com
Define if your app login should prompt the user for consent in the Azure portal on login. none = will never request and rely on SSO (web apps)
Supply a refresh token to get a new valid token for use after expiring

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $tokenInfo = Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser -tenantID 'Azure AD Tenant ID' -clientid 'Application ID' -accessKey 'Preset key for app' -redirectUri 'https redirect uri of app' -resource 'MS API Resource'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $tokenInfo = Get-AzureOAuthTokenUser -tenantID 'Azure AD Tenant ID' -clientid 'Application ID' -accessKey 'Preset key for app' -redirectUri 'https redirect uri of app' -resource 'MS API Resource' -refreshtoken 'your refresh token from a previous call'

maml:description.maml:para: Get azure usage in a CSV format directly - providing a custom date range

There are other options for retrieving usage information. Directly as a CSV non-polling, polling, or JSON. This method requests a custom data file be generated (up to 36 months of data). It is saved to a blob storage point. The function will poll that location until it is available, then output the csv.

maml:Description.maml:para: Your Enterprise Enrollment number. Available form the EA portal.
